contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Pine Tree and Crane by Xu Gu.jpg|thumb|right|250px|'''Xu Gu''', ''Pine Tree and Crane'']] '''Xū Gǔ''' (Hsü Ku, traditional: 虛谷, simplified: 虚谷); ca. (1824–1896) was a [[China|Chinese]] painter and poet during the [[Qing Dynasty]] (1644–1912). Xu was born in [[Xin'an]] in the [[Anhui]] province, and later lived in [[Guangling]] in the [[Jiangsu]] province.<ref name="chinaweb">{{cite web|url=http://www.china-on-site.com/pages/painter/1135.php|title=Xū Gǔ Brief Biography|accessdate=2008-07-17}}</ref> His style name was 'Xugu' and his [[sobriquet]] was 'Ziyang Shanren'. Xu was an army official, and then later a monk. When painting he used the side of the brush in a fluent and bold style.
